title: Srimad Bhagavatam Lecture 2.9.32 by HG Stoka Krishna Prabhu
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: This is the realization of the personal feature of the Absolute Truth, the Personal Attribute of God.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the concept of the personal feature of God and contrasts it with the impersonal view, focusing on the qualities of the Lord.

segments.key_quote: So these are all personal qualities, which are not to be found in any material object, in any dead thing, material thing.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the meaning of 'nirguna' as being without material qualities and differentiates between material and personal qualities.

segments.key_quote: So, the qualities a person displays, or appears to have, are not spiritual qualities. They are all material qualities.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how personal qualities are impermanent and influenced by material nature, emphasizing that they are not spiritual qualities of the soul.

segments.key_quote: So then, how do we understand, that the Supreme Lord, appears in His form as Narasimha, and He displays anger?
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the apparent contradiction of the absolute truth being without material qualities while the Lord displays anger as Narasimha, presenting the impersonalist viewpoint.

segments.key_quote: But, the Bhagavatam describes, that absolute truth, is a transcendental person, and absolute truth has got, transcendental qualities.
segments.summary: The speaker continues to contrast the impersonalist view with the Bhagavatam's description of the absolute truth as a transcendental person with transcendental qualities.

segments.key_quote: Bhagavad Gita describes, ah, in the verse of Arjuna, Arjuna describes Krishna, ah, param brahma paramdhama avitram paramam bhavan purusham shashwatam divyam.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that transcendental qualities cannot be understood through material conceptions and quotes Arjuna's description of Krishna as the eternal, transcendental person.

segments.key_quote: So, there is a different kind of personality, not within our experience normally, but which is described in the scriptures like Bhagavatam and Bhagavad Gita.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Krishna as the origin of all devatas and explains that Krishna's birth is a transcendental activity described in scriptures.

segments.key_quote: So, when we hear about the personality of God in front of the scriptures, it is clearly stated in the scriptures that we should give up all our material conceptions of form, person, qualities, or activities.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the need to abandon material conceptions when understanding the personality of God and introduces the concept of transcendental attributes.

segments.key_quote: So when Lord appears as, Absolute Truth appears as Narasimha, he displays anger that is not a result of rajoguna, because he is completely transcendental to the modes.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna's qualities are not products of material modes and that the anger displayed by Narasimha is a transcendental reciprocation with devotees, setting up the story of Prahlad and Hiranyakashipu.

segments.key_quote: And that made the Lord very angry against Hiranyakashipu. Why did you torture my son, my devotee?
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Hiranyakashipu's persecution of Prahlad and the Lord's anger, emphasizing the Lord's affection for his unalloyed devotee.
